Intro: ^Greg the Farmer: Blessed evening Father, how can I help you?
Hub: ^There is a small skull in your fields.
^Can we go over the letter again?
^Do you know who vandalized Joe's tomb?

c-4: ^Greg the Farmer: I can't say I understand a word in that piece of paper, could you read it out to me?

Bloodstains_1: ^Greg the Farmer: Huh, is it still there? I thought the rain would've washed it away by now. One of the chickens gave me a hell of a fight.
^That looked like a lot of blood for a chicken

c-0: ^Greg the Farmer: Clearly you haven't slayed a chicken before!

Bloodstains_2: ^Greg the Farmer: I can't say I understand a word in that piece of paper, could you read it out to me?

c-0: ^Greg the Farmer: I see... And you say there's no signature or destination? Well, I don't know why it would point to my shed, but...

Letter: ^Greg the Farmer: It's a letter mentioning a wife, so its sender is a married man that can write.
^Greg the Farmer: Joe and Father Wright were the only single men in town. I have never seen that weird doctor with a wife either.
^Greg the Farmer: Brut and I don't know how to write, and neither do our kids.
^Greg the Farmer: Which only leaves Mr Ale and John Smith.

b: ^Greg the Farmer: As to who it's for, I have no idea. Let me know if you find out anything.

Skull: ^Greg the Farmer: Sorry Father, I really don't know who it belongs to. I had never noticed before. Please point me to it and we can give it a proper burial tomorrow.
Joe_Tomb: ^Greg the Farmer: Well... Joe had quite the reputation. It was only rumors, so no one did anything about it, but after all this started with Phillip those rumors sounded more... dangerous.
^Greg the Farmer: I don't think Joe was a murderer, at least not in his time here, but he's as likely to be responsible for some of the deaths as he is not.
^Greg the Farmer: That is all I will say on the matter.
Family: ^Greg the Farmer: They're doing fine, for the most part. Don't like being stuck in the house, but I think they understand why it's being done.
Strange: ^Greg the Farmer: Well, I don't like saying bad things about anyone... But...
^Greg the Farmer: I'm almost sure I saw Tosh digging something up from the graveyard the other day.
^Greg the Farmer: Brut has been drinking heavily since he lost his wife and kid.
^Greg the Farmer: Smith Jr. barely leaves his house since his mom died. A weird kid, that one is.
^Greg the Farmer: That doctor in the market gives me the creeps. There's some rumors about him, you might want to ask Mr. Ale about them.

b: ^Greg the Farmer: Be careful out there, Father.
